meanings.definition: A person who shortens or condenses a written work.
meanings.sent1: The abridgers summarized the book for the students.
meanings.sent2: The abridgers cut down the lengthy novel into a concise version.
meanings.sent3: The abridgers decided to make the story shorter by removing some parts.
meanings.sent4: She was like an abridger, trimming the unnecessary words from the manuscript.
meanings.sent5: The abridgers' job was to make the text more compact and easier to read.

meanings.definition: Those who reduce the length of a text by omitting unnecessary details.
meanings.sent1: The abridgers removed the extra information from the article.
meanings.sent2: A team of abridgers worked together to shorten the document.
meanings.sent3: The abridgers joked about cutting out all the boring parts of the story.
meanings.sent4: The abridgers were like editors, streamlining the content for better understanding.
meanings.sent5: Their role as abridgers was to make the text more concise without losing important information.
